edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image

Class ImagePlusPixelData

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.PixelData
      • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.WritablePixelData
        • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.ImagePlusPixelData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ImagePlusPixelData
extends WritablePixelData
    A type of WritablePixelData that uses an ImageJ ImagePlus as its underlying representation.
    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        protected void init(int size_x,
        int size_y,
        int size_z,
        int size_c,
        int size_t,
        java.lang.String dimensionOrder)
        Description copied from class: PixelData
        Initializes the internals of the PixelData object using the specified parameters.
        Specified by:
        init in class PixelData
        Parameters:
        size_x - The size of the PixelData in the x-dimension (in pixels).
        size_y - The size of the PixelData in the y-dimension (in pixels).
        size_z - The size of the PixelData in the z-dimension (in pixels).
        size_c - The size of the PixelData in the c-dimension (in pixels).
        size_t - The size of the PixelData in the t-dimension (in pixels).
        dimensionOrder - A string containing the 5 characters "XYZCT" in some order specifying the order in which the dimensions are stored in the underlying byte representation.

      • initNewImagePlus

        protected void initNewImagePlus()

      • setPlane

        public void setPlane(int zIndex,
            int cIndex,
            int tIndex,
            byte[] plane)
        Sets the raw byte representation of one plane of the pixel data to the specified array.

        Pixel values should be represented by the numeric type, byte order, and dimension order specified when initializing the PixelData. This will not be checked for the correct format.

        The internal numerical representation of the pixel data will be updated immediately.

        Overrides:
        setPlane in class PixelData
        Parameters:
        zIndex - the z-dimension index of the plane being set (0-indexed)
        cIndex - the c-dimension index of the plane being set (0-indexed)
        tIndex - the t-dimension index of the plane being set (0-indexed)
        plane - A byte array containing the new pixel data for the specified plane.

      • getPlane

        public byte[] getPlane(int index)
                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from class: PixelData
        Get a single plane of the image formatted as a raw byte array. (Optional operation.)

        Always throws an UnsupportedOperationException unless overriden by a subclass.

        Overrides:
        getPlane in class PixelData
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the plane to return in the specified dimension order.
        Returns:
        A byte array holding the requested plane encoded in the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not overridden by a subclass.

      • getPixel

        public float getPixel(int x,
             int y,
             int z,
             int c,
             int t)
        Description copied from class: PixelData
        Gets the value of a single pixel at the specified coordinates.

        Note that the parameters are passed in the order x,y,z,c,t regardless of the ordering in the underlying byte array representation and will be converted to the correct ordering automatically. (All coordinates are zero-indexed.)

        Specified by:
        getPixel in class PixelData
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        y - The y-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        z - The z-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        c - The c-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        t - The t-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        Returns:
        The value of the PixelData at the specified coordinates, as a float.

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel(int x,
            int y,
            int z,
            int c,
            int t,
            float value)
        Description copied from class: WritablePixelData
        Gets the value of a single pixel at the specified coordinates.

        Note that the parameters are passed in the order x,y,z,c,t regardless of the ordering in the underlying byte array representation and will be converted to the correct ordering automatically.

        Likewise, though the value is passed as a float, it will be converted automatically to the underlying byte representation in the correct format. This may lead to the truncation of the passed float value when retrieving the byte array representation. However, the float passed in can still be retreived without truncation by calling PixelData.getPixel(int, int, int, int, int).

        (All coordinates are zero-indexed.)

        Specified by:
        setPixel in class WritablePixelData
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        y - The y-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        z - The z-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        c - The c-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        t - The t-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        value - The value to which the pixel at the specified coordinates will be set.

      • toImagePlus

        public ij.ImagePlus toImagePlus()
        Description copied from class: PixelData
        Returns an ImagePlus representation of the data contained in this PixelData.

        This may return null if an ImagePlus is not involved in the representation of the PixelData.

        Specified by:
        toImagePlus in class PixelData
        Returns:
        An ImagePlus representation of the PixelData, or null.

      • getDimensionOrder

        public java.lang.String getDimensionOrder()
        Description copied from class: PixelData
        Gets the dimension order of the underlying byte representation of the PixelData as a string.

        An example string for one particular dimension order is "XYZCT"

        Overrides:
        getDimensionOrder in class PixelData
        Returns:
        A String containing one character for each dimension specifying the dimension order.

      • getDataType

        public int getDataType()
        Description copied from class: PixelData
        Gets the data type used for the underlying byte array representation.

        The meanings of the integers returned are specified as constants in FormatTools.

        Specified by:
        getDataType in class PixelData
        Returns:
        An integer corresponding to the format of the underlying byte representation of the data.

        Sets the byte order for the pixel data.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
